activities.name: Eiffel Tower
activities.address: Champ de Mars, 5 Avenue Anatole France, 75007 Paris, France
activities.description: The Eiffel Tower is a wrought-iron lattice tower on the Champ de Mars in Paris, France. It is named after the engineer Gustave Eiffel, whose company designed and built the tower.

activities.name: Chez Julien
activities.address: 1 Rue du Pont Louis-Philippe, 75004 Paris, France
activities.description: Chez Julien is a French restaurant located in the Marais district of Paris. It serves traditional French cuisine in a charming and elegant atmosphere.

activities.name: Louvre Museum
activities.description: The Louvre Museum is the world's largest art museum and a historic monument in Paris. It is located in the Louvre Palace, originally built as a fortress in the late 12th century.

activities.name: Notre-Dame Cathedral
activities.address: 6 Parvis Notre-Dame - Pl. Jean-Paul II, 75004 Paris, France
activities.description: Notre-Dame Cathedral is a medieval Catholic cathedral in the fourth arrondissement of Paris. The cathedral is widely considered to be one of the finest examples of French Gothic architecture.

activities.name: Palace of Versailles
activities.description: The Palace of Versailles is a royal château in Versailles, France. It was the residence of the Kings of France from Louis XIV to Louis XVI. The palace is now a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

activities.name: Le Jules Verne
activities.address: Champ de Mars, 5 Avenue Anatole France, 75007 Paris, France
activities.description: Le Jules Verne is a Michelin-starred restaurant located on the second floor of the Eiffel Tower. It offers panoramic views of Paris and serves contemporary French cuisine.

activities.name: Sainte-Chapelle
activities.description: Sainte-Chapelle is a Gothic chapel on the Île de la Cité in the heart of Paris, France. It is renowned for its stunning stained-glass windows and impressive architecture.

activities.name: Montmartre
activities.description: Montmartre is a historic hill in the north of Paris, famous for its artistic heritage and stunning views over the city. It is home to the Sacré-Cœur Basilica, the Moulin Rouge, and many charming cafes and restaurants.
